one_reviews_text: Not the best optimised for newer hardware as it's old but still a very sweet story.
A great movie for kids.
Just get it.  Wonderful story.  Charming, excellent execution.  Not the best VR experience you'll find but well worth your support.

review_title: Fun and will Make you smile
one_reviews_text: This is a fun and very well made story about making a new friend. Family friendly and if you have children, They will love it. I really enjoy it. I give it a Super Nova of Stars
Cute story, well done but I wish it was longer.

this was one of the first things i watched in VR  i thought the graphics were great   very cute short story   it was crisp and clear through out no gliches  or stutters  audio and video was great  the whole thing was just great  Kids would love this for sure  it'd be awsome if more stuff came out like this for the kiddo's

For free, it's certainly worth the 10+ minutes it takes to enjoy this 3D presentation. (Note: Store page description says it's only "free for a limited time", this rating may not be applicable if the product is being sold at a price.)

So i was looking for things for my grandkids, i am 51 and have now watched this loads of times!! its just so cute and i cant wait for my grandkids to play !   if you have issues its probably your equipment lol not Henry! lol  im still getting my head around this VR THING!! the set up the graphics omg.......
Super cute

review_title: Good but the beware of red
one_reviews_text:
Fun couple of minutes but the first time around the whole story was in a weird red tinge, like a strange memory effect.

The second time around I stood up rather than sat down like it suggests and it's colourful rather than red. 

I guess the red effect is their way of saying you're out of the play area.
The best thing about this is that it's short. Otherwise it's uninspired loud and visually unimpressive garbage.

Short movie who mix all expression an human can have, sadness, happyness, funies, deceptionnes etc...

Recommended, it s free
This one brought a little tear to my wifes eye,and a lot of awe's,very nice graphics and solid movement
I love Henry
Very cute and a wonderful VR experience

An ok short BUT with great animation and prescence.

It's difficult to reccomend as small children actually shouldnt use VR but the plot was so rudamentary as to seemingly be for said audience...

It's ok...don't go in expecting much, though...

Great visuals and 3D is great. Tip - stand up and move closer to the balcony edge over your right should where the bed is and you start to see more of the floor under the balcony, its hard to describe being able to see new areas/area not seen from starting point as you move.

A cute and amusing film with a completely 360 degree experience.  Definitely worth watching more that once just so that you can look around Henry's home.  Great for showing friends what a 3D movie really should be.

review_title: Cute Short Film Everyone Should Have
one_reviews_text: An adorable short film to show off some amazing VR visuals and get the viewer situated to observing in a VR environment. The narrative is easy to follow through non-verbal storytelling and you can actually move around the space and change your viewing angle if you so choose. Really neat!

Cute little movie that serves as great entry to vr.   Great that it is free.  Just found a few times the resolution wasn't as crystal clear as I would like, which made it hard to focus but overall happy I saw it (also keep in mind this movie is now over 3 years old).  

By the way, if you are stuck on the 'play' screen you might need an xbox or other pc controller.  That is where you can click one of the buttons to start the movie.  At least that is what worked for me.  I read it online before trying that.
This and Vader Immortal really have me thinking about what immersive storytelling could be. This could replace or augment comics and cartoons at a certain level.
HORRIBLE
Great for kids or VR newbies - cute and 'Dreamworks'-esq.  Recommended!  It would have been nice for additional scenes and if it were longer.  But it's still great regardless!

graphics look great enviroment was awesome staging and animation are top qualilty and the story brought a tear to my eye i cant say enough just expeirnce this you have to! also curios what this was rendered out in RendermanVR? 

Edit: looks like all unreal render engine
I was crying.
Great Graphics, sweet story.
A very cute and innocent short story. I enjoyed it. Especially since it was free. Some slight interaction or more involvement or closeness of action to the user would help show off the vr though.
Can't put it on oculus quest...
What a piece of crap, it's just a logo but the video doesn't play, i can only hear sound

When I try to play this VR movie, there is a lack of color...everything is in a type of sepia tone. I've searched for this issue and I've found that it's related to boundaries and sensor issues...something about the color fading out when you get near the edge of Guardian. However, I don't seem to have any sensor issues (3 sensor setup) and other movies from Oculus Story Studios (Lost, for instance) work fine.

review_title: Would be great if I could actually play
one_reviews_text: Paused at 100 installed and won't let me play it or anything! So frustrating! Glad it was free and not a paid game!
Cool

review_title: Great way to introduce VR to elder/kids
one_reviews_text:
I have been using this short film to introduce VR to the ones who are uncomfortable with VR. It's very innocent and perhaps a bit too innocent. I would like if things or characters came closer to you, to really emphasize that you're in VR. 

This wont be a great experience for those who are confident in VR, if so, give them a better first experience.
i thought it was a very good clip. awesome graphics. keep up the good work.
it is not a waste of time, highly recommended.
Very well done! I liked it very much!
It doesnt work you carnt go on it

review_title: Does not work without Oculus Remote
one_reviews_text: Gets stuck on the "Press Play" screen.
It's a lovely little story and well worth your time. It's pretty, cute, and full of character. Very well done and no issues to report.

Absolutely recommend a view at this short story about a hedgehog who just wants a friend to be able to hug without rejection.  Well animated story set in a cosy treehouse with really good graphics and music.  A good VR to show your friends!
Both working on Rift (real-time 3D) and Go (Carmac 5k 60 fps 360 video), great work! :)
Very cute story with sharp graphics and a cute story.  I would like to see more.  Thanks for the $ of free.
nice
Grab it as long as it's free. Nice little VR "movie". Really well done.
I want more ! Henry was sooo cute !
but the downside is that it only lasts for like 5 mins
It's cute, moving, charming, funny and very well executed.... it just comes together really nicely. A pleasant surprise.

My first VR story experience and it did not dissapoint.  It was truly a WOW experience.  Cute storyline, characters, and environment.  Good for all ages to enjoy.  I treated my 9 year old nephew to this one and he loved it too.  I hope more VR storytelling experiences are in the works!
The characters, the setting, the story, it is all top-notch. It's really easy to connect with them and feel inmersed. Can't recommend this more.
Wife and children are delighted.
It states it "Supports Touch (As Gamepad)" but when I launch it I get stuck on the title screen where it says to press button to start. I only have touch controllers, is there a way to fix this?
This  was so cuyte but sad it actually made me feel like i was experiencing henrys life i was disappointed because i thout it would be a game but i still loved it
Fantastic short story. Definitely earned the awards it got. I demo it to everyone that'll watch, and they love it.
My daughter loves to see it over and over. There's only one problem, now she wants to have a porcupine at home ... ;)
If a 33 year old man and was almost in tears during this. A wonderful piece of art and a testament to the power of VR.
I loved this one, so cute!!!

If there is One thing I can say with certainty in my life up to now! It is that "Up until yesterday! I have never had the pleasure of sitting in on a hedgehogs birthday party!" Today I am happy to report that this is NOT now the case, and I have been sat cross legged on the floor at Henrys house for his birthday! A little gem and a glimpse again into the massive potential for story telling via the RIFT! (Its free for goodness sake, try it yourself and I'll see you next year for his next birthday!) A true hidden classic!
A charming story about loneliness and misunderstanding. Nice ending - kids will love it, it's definitely something to show them. One of the better VR experiences I'd say.
Psh- that henry's such a selfish showoff with his emmy :P
For some reason it only displays in black and white no color.
An utterly charming and heartfelt example of the unbridled storytelling potential of virtual reality. It's free. Go get it now!
Watched this sweet VR video this evening and WHAT A TREAT!  Great way to introduce those that are a little hesitant about VR to the magic that it holds.  Great job guys!  Keep them coming!!
Only have touch controllers and it won't start either, yet it states it can use touch as gamepad

review_title: Worth your time but relatively short
one_reviews_text:
+: Nice visuals and narration - well worth your time!
=: No Oculus Touch support - had to use Xbox controller to initiate the experience.
-: Interactivity with Henry’s eyes occurred only ONCE as far as I can tell which is unfortunate because Saschka Unseld mentioned "… a character will suddenly look at you. Henry will do that and he be aware that you are here watching his story unfold”. That statement seemed to imply more than what was experienced here. Regardless the experience was decent even as of Q3 2017.

More info: While “Lost” felt really boring and uninspired it was definitively not the case with “Henry”. Experiencing "Dear Angelica" from the same studio is also recommended but watch it before Henry so you can boost your morale after with the little Hedgehog.

P.S. Don’t understand why they closed "Oculus Story Studio".

Yeah, this is a great one to show people who aren't interested in gaming. It's simple enough, with no input/skill required. Just sit on the floor and watch Henry go about his business. I would love to see more stuff like this.
Good cartoon 3D VR
One of the best VR experience.
This is something I get everyone that I want to show VR to watch.  Loved it!!!
All the naysayers have no joy in life. This made me want to cry and then it made me laugh and feel super giddy. I loved it so much!
A must have for kids, very beautiful little home, very immersive first VR contact for kids.
The good point is that it's free. Hopefully given that it lasts 10 minutes. Downloading 3Gb of data for 10mn of video hardly makes sense. No interactive part.
I never thought that I would like a child movie. This was so funny! Thanks for the smile :D
This gives kids a great VR experience with balloons flying to them and with a great happy ending!
wow I have hardly even smiled this week and this had me laughing start to finish, brilliant, more PLEASE

This is a 5 star experience, but it losing color when it decides it's not in range of the sensors! Wtf is this!? I'm in the middle of my 3 sensors, just work! I couldn't even sit down because right away went 'sepia'. Please fix it, I can't show it to people without constant looking for the right spot!

review_title: Sitting floating 1 feet above the floor?
one_reviews_text: This totally destroyed the immersion. Plus the voices makes me cringe.
and everyone should download it. Great for showing off VR to friends in a short film. enough said
It's a great disney-like experience. Makes me wonder what the future holds for animated movies.
It's a cute short film with Pixar-like characters, free of charge!
Henry was one of my early experiences with Oculus Rift and it really blew my mind. Basically like being inside a pixar movie. So well made, it's a must download.
wonderful experience, such a shame that occulus story for shut down :(
Simply magical to be inside a Pixar-like movie, to really connect with the character and environments... Such a shame the Oculus studio shut down :( We need more content like this!
very good
A nice storey, for children.

When I ordered my Rift, one of the first things I had planned to download was Henry. The video, pictures, and description of this VR experience really raised my expectations, and got me excited. But I was massivly disappionted. It lasts a couple of minutes and there really is no story. You stay just sat inside his house for the entire experience, and all there is to it is just watching some magical balloons dance and bring him a turtle to be friends with. Thats it. 
It is free, but I seriously am doubting whether is was even worth the time of me downloading it.

I was skeptical, but as I sat there on my floor, I couldn't help but to crack up laughing out loud, and feel absolutely horrible for this poor animal and wished for nothing more than the ability to hug him myself. It's free. Just do it.
Must download for everyone! Fun, entertaining story for all ages. I even showed this to my grandma and she loved it. Looking forward to more from Oculus Story Studios.
What an amazing experience. Looking forward to more like this.
a story book clip for all ages. nicely written -- and its free : )
nice fun heart warming exp great for kids and even i enjoyed it :D a must to download

I really enjoyed watching this. Sweet and simple. Great to show to kids since man it's wild. It's kind of like a bedtime story book brought to life.

I really enjoyed it since it was free so you can't go wrong!

review_title: Could be the future of the bedtime story
one_reviews_text: A short but fun kids story but with the added dimension of VR bringing the whole thing to life. There is definitely potential here as it adds so much to the experience by "being there" instead of simply reading or watching...if you have kids (under 10), then show them this.
Touches the heart - story and the art

review_title: Great Film and a Great Demo
one_reviews_text:
Good story, well narrated.  

Nice short story to show the kids and a great demo of what VR can do for storytelling.

Very immersive, highly recommended!
This short story gives you an idea of what storytelling is like in VR.  While it's free, it's highly recommended.

review_title: Just show it to everyone you know!
one_reviews_text: Everyone will love it :)

I feel that the plot was not that particularity unique and I also feel that many american 3D animators have a need of overdoing expressions. However you feel that the creators put a lot of tought and care into it. It's a very familyfriendly shortfilm and a nice introduction to VR.
Words cannot describe how awesome this is.

It's entertaining, and really gives a look as to what a pixar movie in VR could be like. But would highly recommend using the Oculus debug tool and supersample it higher for better image quality. It's pretty blurry at the default settings. Also I would recommend walking around, and putting a real chair where henry's virtual chair is and sit there, then get up again. It made the experience much more immersive.

I didn't give it 5 stars because I felt there was some untapped potential with interaction and the story there.
If you were like me and sat down on the floor like the kids, I`m sure no matter who you are - that makes you feel like a kid!

This is a fantastic short animation about a lovable hedgehog.  You'll laugh, you'll cry, feel bad and then possibly cry a little bit more but then feel happy again. Definitely shows the potential of VR animation.
Really cute and pretty well animated. Nice short story about friendship. Made me cry inside my rift a little bit. 10/10 would cry again.
The film is about 5 minutes long. Its a good demo of what future VR films might be.
I love pixar movies, but this is way too childish.

Really cute and emotional story.
This is a true example of the potential the VR has. 
rather short, but since it is for free, that can't count as a minus. 
Just watch, and be touched by this masterpiece
Very Enjoyable, kids loved it, short but fun

review_title: What are you, a heartless jerk?
one_reviews_text: How do people give this less than a 4? I don't get it. All the Pathos of a great Pixar film, with Frodo doing the narration. And it's free. Seriously, some people must not have been hugged enough as children.
A message of false hope for those still gullible enough
You guys deserve this!

review_title: Taste the future of Animated Movies
one_reviews_text: Nice little story. Best quality VR experience you can find.

review_title: How all future movies should be
one_reviews_text: Simply put, this short shows the possibility of how future movies might be. Excellent job with the presentation of the short.
2 months later... still one of the best VR experiences. Very adorable hedgehog, colorful graphics. Great to show it to family & friends.
Really cute, shows awesome potential for VR as a storytelling device.
Absolutly Emotional!
This blew me away and can't wait to see more movies in full VR like this.  The future of movies is looking bright.
Adorable
